image.altText: Brianna Hurst wearing sunglasses looking out at the ocean.

props.synopsis: Emergency services praise the "heroic" efforts of a woman who pulled three men from a beach near Apollo Bay on Sunday. One of the men died at the scene, while two others were taken to hospital.

title.children: Bystander 'just jumped into action' to pull three drowning men from Victorian waters

image.altText: Trainer Darren Weir with horse Prince of Penzance in 2015.

props.synopsis: Facing a tribunal hearing with his former assistant trainer and stablehand, Darren Weir has admitted to using an electric shock device but denied allegations he intended to corrupt the outcome of races.

title.children: Horse trainer Darren Weir accused of intending to corrupt 2018 Melbourne Cup outcome

image.altText: A young woman is handcuffed by NSW police during her arrest.

props.synopsis: Exclusive data covering 4.3 million police searches has revealed a quota-driven culture that boosts search numbers at the risk of abusing police powers.

title.children: The three crucial words police say they didn't hear when they botched this arrest – and cost taxpayers $320,000

image.altText: Georgina Williams, Anne Ruston, Peter Dutton, Sussan Ley, Simone Clarke at at UN Women's event at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Liberal preselectors opted for backbench senator Alex Antic as their top ballot pick, relegating shadow cabinet minister Anne Ruston to second, leaving questions about the party's commitment to female candidates, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: Dutton's nightmare nearly comes true as Liberals dump senior woman for top ballot spot

image.altText: Girl and boy model Tasmania Devils AFL team foundation jumper.

props.synopsis: The path for Tasmania's entry into the AFL in 2028 still has many obstacles to overcome. But it's reached a key moment — the official club launch — with nods to the past, present and future.

title.children: Tasmania's AFL and AFLW club name, logo, colours revealed

image.altText: A wet road with a large segment washed away

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Megan has made landfall on the south-western Gulf of the Carpentaria coast, with wind gusts up to 200 kilometres per hour recorded at the core.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Megan makes landfall on Gulf of Carpentaria

image.altText: A woman, shot from behind, holding a smart phone on a street where cars are seen parked on the road.

props.synopsis: After once being described as coming to Australian shores "illegally, like pirates", Uber has agreed to pay millions in compensation to thousands of taxi drivers and operators. Here's what that means for the rideshare giant, its competitors and consumers.

title.children: Uber had a 'move fast and break things' strategy. Now it's paying for the damage

image.altText: A woman stands holding the handle bars of a food delivery bike.

props.synopsis: After Joy spoke out about low pay and rider safety she says Hungry Panda retaliated by reducing her delivery orders.

title.children: This food delivery rider spoke up against Hungry Panda. Then they called the police on her

image.altText: Red Bull Racing Team Principal Christian Horner, Haas F1 Team Principal Guenther Steiner and Jost Capito, CEO of Williams F1.

props.synopsis: Formula One. It's a sport where no one is short of cash but the gulf between the top and bottom teams has increased as former Haas team principal Guenther Steiner knows all too well.

title.children: 'Hope we move on': Former Haas boss Steiner on the Red Bull texting scandal

image.altText: A man sits in a window in a shirt.

props.synopsis: Twenty-three-year-old Hani had almost given up hope when his temporary visa to Australia was reinstated after he spent four days in limbo at an airport in Istanbul.

title.children: 'Right when I began to lose hope, the good news came': Palestinians get Australian visas reinstated after days in limbo

image.altText: A portrait shot of a man in a light blue suit

props.synopsis: Australia's Trade Minister Don Farrell has come under fire from the opposition for declaring he's "not sure" the United States is Australia's most trusted ally, instead arguing New Zealand is.

title.children: Opposition criticises Farrell for questioning if US is Australia's most trusted ally

image.altText: A general view of Parklea Correctional Centre in Sydney

props.synopsis: Lucas Batey, 20, is charged with murdering Kien Vuong, 47, at Parklea Correction Centre between Saturday night and Sunday morning.

title.children: Sydney inmate charged with murder of cellmate allegedly beat him to death

image.altText: A man who has taken a selfie in front of a dirt mount wearing a hard hat.

props.synopsis: Skilled refugees come to Australia hoping to work in their chosen field, but often face a long and expensive process to get their qualifications recognised. As employers grapple with a worker shortage, these experts say it's a problem worth fixing.

title.children: Mohammed heard there was a shortage of engineers in Australia, but what he discovered was 'totally different'

image.altText: closed sign hangs on the inside of business's glass door

props.synopsis: The ATO is chasing more than $34 billion in debts owed by small businesses and self-employed Australians that were put on hold during the pandemic, sending some businesses to the wall.

title.children: As the ATO comes 'out with a vengeance', more small businesses are going under

image.altText: A couple in front of a house

props.synopsis: Homeowners who bought unassuming houses in Melbourne’s east are left mystified by a surprise bid to heritage protect their properties.

title.children: They live in average homes at the back of a Melbourne cul-de-sac — but soon they could be heritage listed

image.altText: A Qantas worker wearing a high-vis vest wipes down an engine that has a red kangaroo logo on it.

props.synopsis: A union representative said affected workers have "lost properties", felt dislocated and experienced "family breakdowns" after the airline outsourced their jobs in August 2020.

title.children: Former Qantas staff 'dragged to hell and back' after COVID illegal sacking return to court seeking millions

image.altText: A middle-aged white man in a shirt and suit jacket sits and glances sideways. An asian man in glasses sits near him.

props.synopsis: This week Elon Musk's company x.AI published Grok's source code. It is the AI equivalent of a celebrity chef revealing the secret to their signature dish, and hand-delivering you the ingredients, writes Ange Lavoipierre.

title.children: Elon Musk just shared the recipe to his 'anti-woke' chatbot Grok to the world. Is that a bad thing?

image.altText: Figurines with computers and smartphones are seen in front of the words "Artificial Intelligence AI" in this illustration.

props.synopsis: Before the government does anything to regulate and legislate AI, we need to have our own reckoning as a community about how we want to use this technology or face having those decisions made for us again, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: A quiet revolution threatens to change everything in our lives, yet there's little national debate over it

image.altText: Sandy beach foreshore in early morning. Wind-blown palm trees, empty children's playground & two people on boardwalk in distance

props.synopsis: A man who was arrested after three woman ran across the Dampier foreshore in WA to stop him holding his son's head in the water was hearing voices at the time, a court has heard.

title.children: Meth paranoia drove dad to hold son's head under water in terrifying foreshore 'baptism'

image.altText: Corruption findings face legal challenge after ICAC's High Court 'disaster'

props.synopsis: Katie Joyner, a planning department official, was accused under parliamentary privilege of using secret information to buy a house in a Sydney suburb set for rezoning.

title.children: 'Extremely embarrassing': NSW planning official cleared of corruption after allegations aired in parliament

image.altText: Tony Burke smiles at Anthony Albanese during QT

props.synopsis: Both chambers were meant to sit next Thursday, which is Holy Thursday, but senior coalition MPs have raised issues with some politicians making it home in time to attend Good Friday events.

title.children: House of Reps members give themselves extra-long weekend — as it happened

image.altText: Mitch East smiling wearing a navy suit and white shirt against a white background

props.synopsis: Mitch East has been remembered as a "highly talented lawyer" by his law firm after he died in a suspected hit and run in Sydney's eastern suburbs yesterday.

title.children: Man killed in suspected hit and run in Sydney's east identified as lawyer Mitch East

image.altText: Peter Garrett sitting in a dark room lit by fairy lights with plants in the background.

props.synopsis: Midnight Oil frontman Peter Garrett says he's "surprised" to have the power, passion and energy to release new music at 70.

title.children: Why Peter Garrett refuses to let personal tragedy define him

image.altText: An illustration of light globes featuring the face of Craig Souter

props.synopsis: Following a horror two years in energy markets, there had been hopes of price relief for consumers. Experts are warning people not to get their hopes up.

title.children: His last power bill sent single dad Craig into shock. This is how analysts like our chances of prices dropping

image.altText: Serious looking woman facing camera, open patio structure in background, table, surfboard on wall, plants

props.synopsis: Lying on his bed 24 hours a day in complete darkness, Dan Harris's life is slipping away. His parents want money put into research to help the quarter of a million Australians with myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome.

title.children: Mother heartbroken as son 'loses everything' from chronic fatigue

image.altText: Perth skies glow orange as a result of a bush fire in the hills.

props.synopsis: Most stories during WA's record-breaking heatwave last month didn't mention the health risks of extreme heat and the link with climate change, despite overwhelming scientific evidence, according to an analysis of how news outlets reported on the event.

title.children: 'Vaguely terrifying': When heatwaves hit my city, the media downplayed the role of climate change

image.altText: Extreme close up of Indigenous child's eye.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Department for Child Protection (DCP) has apologised over claims of "indefensible" practices of removing newborns from First Nations mothers shortly after birth, causing trauma to the mothers, families and health staff.

title.children: 'DCP workers actually entered the delivery room': Claims of 'indefensible' baby removals from First Nations mothers

image.altText: Close-up of woman sitting by window with a neutral expression, wearing a check button-up shirt.

props.synopsis: 'Escape funds' may seem less relevant than they were for our mothers and grandmothers, but some experts say they are common sense and a way to feel 'safer' in relationships.

title.children: Linda has an 'escape fund' in case her relationship goes south. Should you?

image.altText: Two brown and white birds with big open beaks

props.synopsis: Let's find out how well you know your backyard birds. Will you get the squawk of approval?

title.children: Quiz: Do you know your magpies from your rosellas and bin chickens?

image.altText: A man in the water holds a large fish

props.synopsis: It's a high-adrenaline hobby with its fair share of risks, but even those who've witnessed shark attacks are still spearfishing.

title.children: Zachary's hobby requires a harpoon gun and buckets of courage, and it's booming in popularity

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin speaks during a news conference.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin's grip on Russia's presidency has tightened after early results in an election, many claim was rigged, indicated he'd win almost 90 per cent of the vote — although not everything went his way.

title.children: Thousands turn up to vote against Putin in Russia and abroad

image.altText: A butterfly with blueish body fading to purple wings on dried grass.

props.synopsis: A Victorian plant nursery is growing a native shrub to help expand the habitat of the golden-rayed blue butterfly, found exclusively in western Victoria.

title.children: This endangered butterfly is a fussy eater, so a nursery is helping grow its food
